title: Hodlshi
author: Hodlshi
content: Anyone could share link website or thread for coin claim-able for those older transactions or holder BTC.I have casascius but i'm only claim BCH for now, any recommendation for claim those coins ?

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Quote from: Hodlshi on January 06, 2023, 10:36:16 AMAnyone could share link website or thread for coin claim-able for those older transactions or holder BTC.I have casascius but i'm only claim BCH for now, any recommendation for claim those coins ? Maybe you can check this thread by @LoyceV LoyceV's Bitcoin Fork claiming guide (and service).And probably this is the only thread that you will need to read to be able to claim other coins, if they are worth by this time.Best of luck.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Hodlshi on January 06, 2023, 10:36:16 AMAnyone could share link website or thread for coin claim-able for those older transactions or holder BTC.I have casascius but i'm only claim BCH for now, any recommendation for claim those coins ? For BCH you need to have BTC before block 478558[1] hence you need the private key of the address where you own your coins.Note that you do not need any bitcoins for this process, so before extracting the private key, send all the bitcoins to a new address, extract the private key, and then download Electron Cash[2], import that private key in that wallet.If you tell us the name of the wallet you used to receive bitcoins, the answer will be more accurate, or search Google using this formula.Code:Extract <wallet name here> private key[1] https://blockchain.info/block/0000000000000000011865af4122fe3b144e2cbeea86142e8ff2fb4107352d43[2] https://electroncash.org/

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: Depending on how and when you claimed BCH, you may or may not have lost other forks due to the lack of replay protection. If you share the address (bad for privacy) I'll check it for you.
